statement.tex: \text{Find the equation of all lines having slope -1}\\ \text{that are tangents to the curve}\\ \quad y = \dfrac{1}{x-1},x\neq 1.

step.context: \text{In which of the two graphs are points}\\ \text{A and B likely to have tangents with slope -1?}
step.reason: \text{A line with slope -1 would go from the}\\ \text{bottom-right to the top-left corner.}

step.context: \text{Is the analysis below complete and correct?}
step.reason: \text{As }(x-1)^2=1\implies x-1=\pm 1,\\ \text{ you should get two tangents.}
